refnamediv.refpurpose: Get a Certificate Transparency log from a CTLOG_STORE

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: A Signed Certificate Timestamp (SCT) identifies the Certificate Transparency (CT) log that issued it using the log's LogID (see RFC 6962, Section 3.2). Therefore, it is useful to be able to look up more information about a log (e.g. its public key) using this LogID.
CTLOG_STORE_get0_log_by_id() provides a way to do this. It will find a CTLOG in a CTLOG_STORE that has a given LogID.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: CTLOG_STORE_get0_log_by_id returns a CTLOG with the given LogID, if it exists in the given CTLOG_STORE, otherwise it returns NULL.

refsection.title: HISTORY
refsection.para: This function was added in OpenSSL 1.1.0.
